gw.api.databuilder

Class PolicyBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.databuilder.DataBuilder<T,B>
      • gw.api.databuilder.CCDataBuilder<Policy,PolicyBuilder>
        • gw.api.databuilder.PolicyBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueGenerator<Policy>

    public class PolicyBuilder
extends CCDataBuilder<Policy,PolicyBuilder>

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Type Property and Description
      static PolicyBuilder commercial
      Creates a builder for a policy with commercial property policy type.
      static PolicyBuilder uiReadyCommercial
      Creates a builder for an unverified comm prop policy with a new company as the insured.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PolicyBuilder()
      Default values: Policy number: selected using POLICY_NUMBER_GENERATOR Currency: the object returned by CurrencyUtil.getReportingCurrency() Producer code: selected using PRODUCER_CODE_GENERATOR Effective date: INIT_TIME Orig effective date: INIT_TIME Cancellation date: INIT_TIME Expiration date: INIT_TIME

      PolicyBuilder effectiveNow()
      Sets the effective date to a day 6 months in the past, the expiration date to a day 6 months in the future, and the origEffectiveDate and cancellationDate to null.
      PolicyBuilder effectiveTodayForFiveDays()
      Sets the effective date as one business day from today (to avoid falling on a non-business day) and the expiration date as five business days from today.
      PolicyBuilder forSamePolicyPeriodAs(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
      Sets the effective date, expiration date, and policy number to those of the given policyPeriod.

      Creates a builder for a policy with general liability policy type.

      PolicyBuilder unverified()
      Clears the verified flag, indicating that non-internal fields may have been changed since this policy was retrieved from external system.

      Sets the verified flag, indicating that no non-internal fields have been changed since this policy was retrieved from external system.

      Sets the account number for this Policy to be a number different from that chosen by any other call of withUniqueAccountNumber

      Adds a RiskUnit for the vehicle to this policy.

      Sets the verified flag, which, when true, indicates that no non-internal fields have been changed since this policy was retrieved from external system.

    • Property Detail

      • commercial

        public static PolicyBuilder commercialProperty
        Creates a builder for a policy with commercial property policy type.

      • uiReadyCommercial

        public static PolicyBuilder uiReadyCommercialProperty
        Creates a builder for an unverified comm prop policy with a new company as the insured. Not technically ui ready as it has to be set on a Claim before committed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PolicyBuilder

        public PolicyBuilder()
        Default values:
        • Policy number: selected using POLICY_NUMBER_GENERATOR
        • Currency: the object returned by CurrencyUtil.getReportingCurrency()
        • Producer code: selected using PRODUCER_CODE_GENERATOR
        • Effective date: INIT_TIME
        • Orig effective date: INIT_TIME
        • Cancellation date: INIT_TIME
        • Expiration date: INIT_TIME

      • withCurrency

        public PolicyBuilder withCurrency(Currency currency)
        Sets the Policy's currency. Instead of calling this method, most tests should set Claim.Policy.Currency after creating the claim and policy, which sets the currency on both entities at once.
        Parameters:
        currency - the policy currency
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withCoveredParty

        public PolicyBuilder withCoveredParty(Contact contact,
                                      java.lang.Integer partyNumber,
                                      CoveredPartyType partyType)
        Adds the given contact to the policy with the "coveredparty" role
        Parameters:
        contact - the contact to add
        partyNumber - if non null, the party number of the claim contact role will be set to this value
        partyType - if non null, the covered party type of the claim contact role will be set to this value
        Returns:
        the modified builder

        Parameters:
        contactBuilder - ValueGenerator that will return the Contact to add
        partyNumber - if non null, the party number of the claim contact role will be set to this value
        partyType - if non null, the covered party type of the claim contact role will be set to this value
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withNewPersonInsured

        public PolicyBuilder withNewPersonInsured()
        Creates a new person and adds it as the insured. Uses PersonBuilder.uiReadyPerson() The insured will not have an AddressBookUID set.
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withNewPersonInsured

        public PolicyBuilder withNewPersonInsured(boolean withLinkedPerson)
        Creates a new person and adds it as the insured. Uses PersonBuilder.uiReadyPerson()
        Parameters:
        withLinkedPerson - true if the new person should have an AddressBookUID set.
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withNewCompanyInsured

        public PolicyBuilder withNewCompanyInsured()
        Creates a new company and adds it as the insured. Uses CompanyBuilder.uiReadyCompany()
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • effectiveNow

        public PolicyBuilder effectiveNow()
        Sets the effective date to a day 6 months in the past, the expiration date to a day 6 months in the future, and the origEffectiveDate and cancellationDate to null.
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • forSamePolicyPeriodAs

        public PolicyBuilder forSamePolicyPeriodAs(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Sets the effective date, expiration date, and policy number to those of the given policyPeriod. Useful for generating a second claim/policy in the same policy period as a first one.
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withRiskUnit

        public PolicyBuilder withRiskUnit(RiskUnit riskUnit,
                                  boolean autoAssignRUNumber)
        Adds a RiskUnit to the policy, setting all of its Coverages to refer to the Policy being created and optionally assigning it the next RiskUnit number.
        Parameters:
        riskUnit - the risk unit to add
        autoAssignRUNumber - whether to set the RiskUnit number to the next in the sequence
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withRiskUnit

        public PolicyBuilder withRiskUnit(ValueGenerator<? extends RiskUnit> riskUnitBuilder,
                                  boolean autoAssignRUNumber)
        Adds a RiskUnit to the policy, setting all of its Coverages to refer to the Policy being created and optionally assigning it the next RiskUnit number.
        Parameters:
        riskUnitBuilder - ValueGenerator that will generate the risk unit to add
        autoAssignRUNumber - whether to set the RiskUnit number to the next in the sequence
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withVehicle

        public PolicyBuilder withVehicle()
        Adds a new vehicle to the policy, created with VehicleBuilder.uiReadyVehicle()
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withVehicle

        public PolicyBuilder withVehicle(Vehicle vehicle)
        Adds a RiskUnit for the vehicle to this policy. RiskUnit is generated with VehicleRUBuilder.uiReadyRiskUnit(ValueGenerator)
        Parameters:
        vehicle - the vehicle to add to the policy through a new VehicleRU
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withVehicle

        public PolicyBuilder withVehicle(ValueGenerator<Vehicle> vehicleBuilder)
        Adds a RiskUnit for the vehicle to this policy. RiskUnit is generated with VehicleRUBuilder.uiReadyRiskUnit(ValueGenerator)
        Parameters:
        vehicleBuilder - the vehicle to add to the policy through a new VehicleRU
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • withVehicle

        public PolicyBuilder withVehicle(Currency currency,
                                 ValueGenerator<Vehicle> vehicleBuilder)
        Adds a RiskUnit for the vehicle to this policy. RiskUnit is generated with VehicleRUBuilder.uiReadyRiskUnit(Currency, ValueGenerator)
        Parameters:
        currency - the VehicleCoverageBuilder exposure and incident limit currency
        vehicleBuilder - the vehicle to add to the policy through a new VehicleRU
        Returns:
        the modified builder

      • effectiveTodayForFiveDays

        public PolicyBuilder effectiveTodayForFiveDays()
        Sets the effective date as one business day from today (to avoid falling on a non-business day) and the expiration date as five business days from today. Also clears the cancellation date
        Returns:
        the modified builder
